meanings.definition: Of or relating to a building or buildings.
meanings.sent1: The edificial structure stood tall in the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed an edificial masterpiece that impressed everyone.
meanings.sent3: The edificial facade of the house made it look like a castle.
meanings.sent4: Her edificial imagination built entire cities in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The edificial charm of the old church drew visitors from far and wide.

meanings.definition: Constructed or used as a building.
meanings.sent1: The edificial materials used in the construction were top quality.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins revealed edificial remnants of a lost civilization.
meanings.sent3: The edificial walls of the fortress kept the enemies at bay.
meanings.sent4: His edificial skills were evident in the sturdy bridge he built.
meanings.sent5: The edificial beauty of the historic mansion captured the attention of passersby.
